Package com.mackenziehigh.snowflake

Interface ITreeNode

All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<ITreeNode>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractTreeNode, TreeNode
public interface ITreeNode extends Iterable<ITreeNode>
An instance of this class is a node in a syntax-tree.
Author:
Mackenzie High

  • Method Details

    • childAt

      ITreeNode childAt(int index)
      This method returns the child-node of this node at a given index.

      Zero is the index of the left-most child of this node, if this node has children.

      Parameters:
      index - is the index of the child-node to return.
      Returns:
      the child-node at index in the array of children.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if no child-node is at the given index.

    • childCount

      int childCount()
      This method returns the number of children of this node.
      Returns:
      the number of children that this node has, or zero, if this node is a leaf node.

    • children

      ITreeNode[] children()
      This method returns an array that contains the children of this node.

      Warning: Do NOT modify the returned array!

      Returns:
      the children of this node, or an empty array, if this node has no children.

    • rule

      String rule()
      This method returns the name of the rule that created this node.
      Returns:
      the aforedescribed name.

    • start

      int start()
      This method returns the start index of the region of the input that this node covers.
      Returns:
      the index of the first character in the matched region of the parser's input.

    • length

      int length()
      This method returns the length of the region of the input that this node covers.
      Returns:
      the length of the matched region of the parser's input.

    • text

      String text()
      This method returns the text from the matched region of input that this node covers.
      Returns:
      the textual form of the region of input that is covered by this node.

    • input

      char[] input()
      This method returns the char[] that is the parser's input.

      Warning: Do NOT modify the returned array.

      Returns:
      the char[] that backs this object.

    • iterableDFS

      Iterable<ITreeNode> iterableDFS()
      This method returns a depth-first-search iterable over the tree rooted at this node.
      Returns:
      the aforedescribed iterator.

    • iterableBFS

      Iterable<ITreeNode> iterableBFS()
      This method returns a breadth-first-search iterable over the tree rooted at this node.
      Returns:
      the aforedescribed iterator.

    • iterableLeavesFirst

      Iterable<ITreeNode> iterableLeavesFirst()
      This method returns a leaves-first iterable over the tree rooted at this node.

      In other words, this iterator visits all-leafs nodes first, from left to right.

      Returns:
      the aforedescribed iterator.

    • iterator

      Iterator<ITreeNode> iterator()
      This method returns a depth-first-search iterator over the tree rooted at this node.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<ITreeNode>
      Returns:
      iteratorDFS()

    • toString

      String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
